C15C6C26A72449CCBF27CF06FA3F56C5.description:
Analyze and
document how music is
influenced by understanding
the time and place in which it
was created, the available
resources, and cultural uses.

B7C706932DDE41A29D903E570A3E53B0.description:
With increasing
independence, make
connections between
music and other common
core subjects, including the
arts, through creating,
performing, or responding
to music.

B2B9E7A4E859420D89EA3A9B65C13A4B.description:
With increasing
independence, connect
music to other people’s
personal life experiences,
when creating,
performing, or
responding to music.

3F8F58DE2BB44AE384C3B79CB1CCF7EF.description:
With increasing
independence,
connections between
music and other personal,
societal, cultural, and
historical ways of
communication through
creating, performing, or
responding to music.

C57A69230288417FA440E19628B1D6EC.description:
Describe the
relationships of music
to dance, theatre, visual
arts, media arts, and
other disciplines.

644351D943F04A8E9DB073F3F07C03A8.description:
Describe and
explain factors that
impact the roles of music
in the lives of people.

2340229F6EF14C4C8C55477B87D75969.description:
Describe and
justify how music is a
form of personal,
societal, cultural, and
historical communication
and expression.

7900F1B40B184123B47F535E71843CCE.description:
Relate artistic ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical
context to deepen understanding.

B3AEFD3BD84648E28060607DA3ED6029.description:
Use musical
skills learned in class as
part of music making
both inside and outside
the classroom and
school, including afterschool programs,
community musicmaking, and
extracurricular
opportunities.

C28D46525FBF4C6EBA771E404BE0381D.description:
Identify and
describe personal and
cultural influences as
well as creative
preferences in creating,
performing, and
responding to music.

E9F5C19172C748EAA9D6DDF8D1B3FB31.description:
Describe how
interests, experiences,
knowledge, and skills
relate to personal
choices and musical
intentions when
creating, performing,
and responding to
music.

A46E25C086D44DF7BAAAE8F120E6174B.description: Synthesize and relate knowledge and personal experiences to make art.

6375343E9F5C4549BEFD3A8AFBBD87E6.description:
Compare and
contrast musical
elements from two or
more selections of
music.

4CEC1165F578489A84CCEEB780226B0E.description:
Engage
appropriately as an
active listener in formal
and informal settings,
paying attention to
audience etiquette
appropriate to the genre
of music.

729F1E2671AF4CC881B45E9C7238F958.description:
Choose pieces
of music or musical
performances from both
familiar and unfamiliar
styles, and evaluate the
quality according to
given criteria. Clearly
communicate and
support a point of view
using appropriate
musical vocabulary,
citing evidence based on
the given criteria.

3EC4AB0EB53B4B8D82EC8A7E7729DE8C.description:
Describe and
support personal
evaluation of musical
works or performances
based on existing or
developed criteria, using
appropriate musical
vocabulary.

ADD395E02CA840C99447B6941187C248.description: Apply criteria to evaluate artistic work.

383219B7CEAE4762BC67867B84F901E8.description:
When listening
to music, describe how
the performers’
personal interpretation
and musical choices
convey creative intent.

B76A560D4D6941FF92065B6E4972D6B2.description:
Describe and
support personal
interpretations of music
and analyze how use of
musical elements,
attention to context,
and artistic qualities
convey intent.

5579CE6D87574C1D858EB00BF35B03B7.description: Interpret intent and meaning in artistic work.

387DE79AC3A4475E91F249547E29207D.description:
With increasing
independence,
communicate the
importance of
structure, musical
elements, and context
when listening to
music.

23F02D09EFE7480285AD538E7EE08C5F.description:
Compare the
use of musical elements
and contexts when
selecting a variety of
music for listening or
performing. Justify the
choices with evidence
based on the
comparison.

B7399C61C89A44C6A99CEE75F3AAC710.description:
Demonstrate,
describe, and compare
the structure, use of
musical elements, and
context (social, cultural,
and historical) in a
variety of musical
pieces.

397D0A9B87AE4BFF940A4AE1D48D3235.description:
Select musical
programs for listening,
and demonstrate
connections to
interests, experiences,
and purposes.

89CE772DF21F432388049EECBEA1D71B.description:
Determine
readiness of a varied
repertoire of music for
public performance,
based on experience of
time, place, and culture
from which the music is
chosen.

DF7C3B761F124DB3969BA3FBC2BEAD8A.description:
Interact
effectively with the
audience and other
performers to convey
the artistic purpose of
the piece as well as
intended
interpretation. Reflect
with the listeners in
discussion or other
activity appropriate to
the context.

4D357F96656242F0A9D4760E30E59D51.description:
Perform a
varied repertoire of
music with artistic
purpose, demonstrating
technical proficiency.

C426CBF3817B430DBFC9029903C173C4.description:
Demonstrate
performance decorum
appropriate to the
context.

C24048C95FC74666AD85033935D1DCFA.description:
Communicate
purpose through music
performance, paying
attention to accuracy,
interpretation, and
composer’s intent.

6C8E7DDBD8F64822ACD7DBC03586855A.description: Convey meaning through the presentation of artistic work.

E003B5751F5543E0BDED8F76597F2BFC.description:
As self-directed
learners and with
teacher assistance,
manage goals and time
with flexibility, to
address newly
identified challenges, in
order to improve
quality of musical
experience for
performers and
listeners.

DFB7EF4E1FEF49F296D2D35BD1A4F476.description:
Apply feedback
to improve and refine
music in rehearsal.

65CF9455B43A48C38550F26D20F7A9AD.description:
With limited
teacher guidance,
identify and apply
collaboratively
developed criteria to
explore multiple ideas
during the rehearsal
process, in order to
improve performance
quality, technical
accuracy and artistic
purpose.

101FF41B30BF4D6992885C79885A812D.description:
Identify and
apply appropriate
feedback to determine
rehearsal practices,
areas of refinement,
and readiness of
performance.

3024C26FB8EE41B6A66E26D8CD02B9C2.description: Develop and refine artistic work for presentation.

C37D325328404C628BA8D2546908161D.description:
Read from iconic
notation, standard notation,
or alternative notation
systems in preparation for
performance, considering
appropriate context.

B2B600E8EE614DA6B817F39088DA994C.description:
Support and justify
the use of artistic qualities
when interpreting music
for performance.

EEA30D67BC8A4307964DFB26BBDAFD60.description:
Explain and
compare the use of musical
contexts in describing
choices of music selected
for performance.

8BB69723E921493A9F47338D6B90B34D.description:
With limited
guidance, select a piece of
music to read, analyze, and
perform with attention to
context and artistic purpose.
Justify and support
performance decisions.

1790DFAACF644CF2BCACF02E0507A0CE.description:
Read and perform
from iconic and/or
standard notation,
considering appropriate
context for different
notation systems.

0DFBD871FC654A588DCB5D0798AE74EA.description:
Describe and
explain how intent is
communicated through
interpretation, including
expressive aspects and
musical elements.

7CA8720E42C24958B0B202C7F10B3D49.description:
Describe and
analyze how context
(historical, cultural, social,
and personal) informs
performance.

05CB51651BC847B498B2DC7A3D0C0E18.description:
Apply criteria to
determine the selection of
music for performance
based on purpose, context,
technical skill, and artistic
qualities.

73E5FA11966B4EF7A2E4A011B0275AC7.description: Analyze, interpret, and select artistic work for presentation.

CA248ED46B334FE79302BD6DAA41CEAA.description:
Present a
performance-ready
version and clearly
support judgments and
decisions made during
the creative process,
including refinement,
using appropriate
technology as available.

B317BBD3F8B34D85BCDB804CD9E3EC2C.description:
Incorporate
refinements to personal
musical ideas through
analysis and
implementation of
feedback.

787D7B385DC74DF5B8400F5587C54321.description:
Think critically
to evaluate and refine
personal musical ideas in
response to feedback
and document revisions.

576F8DAD1B8046F4B2524B10E1517E6E.description:
Present a
performance-ready
version of personal
musical ideas
demonstrating a
developing level of craft
and artistic purpose.

A0424417D2C1414388BAC79A4C8DF234.description:
Support rationale
for refinements to
personal musical ideas
based on feedback from
multiple sources.

D1C5EA24AE6C4A6A9A1FA5ECC3740846.description:
Apply given and
self-selected criteria
(including elements of
context and intent) to
evaluate and summarize
refinements to personal
musical ideas.

74581AA3DC9A4104B2824C564E71805D.description:
Apply tools,
which may include
standard notation,
iconic notation, or
recording technology,
to notate or record
personal musical ideas.
Craft a composer’s
statement that clearly
summarizes and
supports creative and
conceptual choices.

796D248DA6184A6398B846C27E8E550A.description:
Use a variety of
media and methods,
including available
technology, to select,
present, explain, and
document musical ideas
with connections to
context and artistic
purpose.

CDAC41E9AD05431FB1067070A685C23A.description: Organize and develop artistic ideas and work.

73E9F054794545F995D6CB38BBC785FF.description:
Create music
with advancing melodic,
rhythmic, dynamic, and
formal elements,
including simple
harmony, in response
to artistic stimuli, using
appropriate technology
as available.

6F75FD00E6BE470B9CF81AD1EBB0F981.description:
Working both
independently and in
collaboration with
others, create musical
works that clearly
communicate personal,
cultural, or historical
experience, using
appropriate technology
as available.

697E85469CC448CFA290445724B8492B.description:
Conceptualize
and generate musical
works, within a variety
of forms, for given
contexts and artistic
purposes, using
appropriate technology
as available.

2620CCBEF5CF4ACC955990D5A67F1265.description: Generate and conceptualize artistic ideas and work.
